unnormalised: ## Return to Sender? Navigating the Wild West of Return Policies, Desi Style!
normalised: ## Return to Sender? Navigating the Wild West of Return Policies, Desi Style!

unnormalised: Let's be honest, we've all been there. That online kurta that looked *amazing* on Isha's Instagram suddenly resembles a repurposed sack when you unpack it. Or that "genuine leather" wallet from Flipkart turns out to be...well, something that smells suspiciously like rubber. What then, mere mortals? We venture into the dreaded land of Return Policies.

Or that "genuine leather" wallet from Flipkart turns out to be...well, something that smells suspiciously like rubber. What then, mere mortals? We venture into the dreaded land of Return Policies.

unnormalised: Reading return policies is about as enjoyable as waiting in line at a ration shop in the scorching Delhi heat. So many terms, so many conditions! Is it "unworn" if I tried it on once while humming to a Bollywood song? Does "original packaging" mean I have to painstakingly re-fold the saree exactly the way it was, even though I’ve already mangled it beyond recognition during a desperate selfie session?

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the "restocking fee." Restocking fee? What am I, running a five-star hotel where they need to fluff the pillows after I merely *glanced* at them? This isn't Ambanis' Antilia, we're talking about a slightly crumpled bedsheet from a sale at the local Fabindia outlet (worth Rs. 499, Dr. Sahil's recommendation, might I add).

unnormalised: Then there's the whole “7-day return window” thing. Seven days! That's barely enough time to decide if I even *like* the miniature Ganesha idol I impulsively bought at a street market in Kolkata. By the time I've asked my mom, aunties, and the local chaiwala for their opinions, the return window has slammed shut like a rusty gate.

unnormalised: Pro-tip: Screenshot *everything*. Chat logs, order confirmations, even the slightly suspicious-looking delivery guy's expression. You never know when you'll need to unleash your inner lawyer to fight for your hard-earned Rs. 500 refund.

unnormalised: Remember that time Rajesh bought a "hand-loom" carpet online only to discover it was machine-made in China and covered in glitter glue? He fought tooth and nail, armed with screenshots and sheer willpower. He got his refund! A true hero.

unnormalised: So, the next time you're staring down the barrel of a complicated return policy, remember Rajesh, and remember: knowledge is power. And a little bit of nagging never hurt anyone. Now go forth and conquer those return policies, my friends! Just make sure you have enough chai to get you through it. Maybe even a samosa or two, just in case. And definitely avoid buying anything larger than 100 sq ft online unless you’re prepared for a logistical nightmare.
